Whether you were eager to leave or not seemed irrelevant to the elders; you had the talent, so you must go. You don't know how the elders had the connections or influence to sponsor your education there, but you've left your tightknit community behind for the city of Nantambu and the Magaambya at its heart.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in your choice of the {@skill Crafting} or {@skill Survival} skill. You gain a skill feat: {@feat Crafter's Appraisal|APG} if you chose {@skill Crafting} or {@feat Forager} if you chose {@skill Survival}. You're also trained in the {@skill Lore} skill appropriate for the terrain around your community (such as {@skill Lore||Forest Lore} or {@skill Lore||Jungle Lore}).
Your recommended primary branch is the Cascade Bearers.

Several members of your family have studied at the Magaambya, although not all of them have graduated as lore-speakers (or even advanced past initiates to become attendants). Your family has decided that you're an excellent candidate to join their ranks. Although lore-speakers of the Magaambya know they are supported by the strength of thousands of graduates who have come before them, you can take the smaller, more personal comfort in the support of your family.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in your choice of the {@skill Diplomacy} or {@skill Society} skill. You gain a skill feat: {@feat Hobnobber} if you chose {@skill Diplomacy} or {@feat Eye for Numbers|APG} if you chose {@skill Society}. You're also trained in {@skill Lore||Magaambya Lore}.
Your recommended primary branch is the Uzunjati.

You have known the Magaambyan teacher Takulu Ot and his wife Niana for many years. Both are amateur bird-watchers and musicians, and you share one of these hobbies. They are pleasant people and well-regarded in Nantambu, although their unshakable generosity and friendliness strike cynics as too earnest to be genuine.
You know otherwise; Takulu and Niana are just as sincere as they appear.
Takulu always seemed to watch you with a discerning eye, and one day he idly observed that you'd do well at the Magaambya.

Talking about it further with him, Takulu agreed that he would sponsor you personally and be the one to give your intake interview. With a twinkle in his eye, he asked that you call him Teacher Ot from now on, just as all of his students do.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in your choice of the {@skill Survival} or {@skill Performance} skill. You gain a skill feat: {@feat Survey Wildlife} if you chose {@skill Survival} or {@feat Impressive Performance} if you chose {@skill Performance}. You're also trained in {@skill Lore||Nantambu Lore}.
Your recommended primary branch is the Emerald Boughs.

You have aspirations of attending the Magaambya academy of magic, but fate seemed to thwart you at every turn. You were unable to obtain a sponsorship and lost a collection of helpful textbooks to unexpected insect damage. You nevertheless made the long trip to Nantambu through terrible weather, uncharacteristically bad roads, and indifferent fellow travelers. Yet you have persevered. Now that you are here, alone but determined, you won't let anything stand in your way.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in your choice of the {@skill Diplomacy} or {@skill Intimidation} skill. You gain a skill feat: {@feat Group Impression} if you chose {@skill Diplomacy} or {@feat Intimidating Glare} if you chose {@skill Intimidation}. You're also trained in {@skill Lore||Academia Lore}.
Your recommended primary branch is the Tempest-Sun Mages.

Prior to the Evisceration of 4707, the district of V'drysha was a lovely borough on the southern edge of Ecanus. Now, it's the Awful, a vast morass of spell-resistant flesh and sinew, ever threatening to engulf the city. You were once a Scab working to push back its infuence. It's a nasty, dangerous job, and poorly paid as well, but at least you learned enough to mimic a viscerasuit, the enchanted, airtight suit that protected you from the poisons and plagues of the Awful.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Constitution, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in {@skill Medicine} and {@skill Lore||Fleshforged Lore}. You also know how to seal your clothing or armor like a viscerasuit. During your daily preparations, you can seal your outft. The frst time each day you are introduced to {@trait poison} or {@trait disease} without taking physical damage, the sealed outft attempts to counteract it using your {@skill Medicine} modifer as the counteract modifer.

The living residents of Geb are known as the quick, and is not, overall, a very pleasant thing to be. While some of the quick choose to make their best of their lot, or even thrive in Geb's undead-dominated society, you decided that whatever terrors the outside world holds, they pale in comparison to those that make up the Gebbite upper class. And considering that escape means braving the Mana Wastes, you must have been very, very certain indeed.
Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in the {@skill Stealth} skill, and the {@skill Lore||Undead Lore} skill. When you {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak} successfully, you are also {@condition hidden} or {@condition concealed} from {@trait undead||undeads'} {@ability lifesense} and other special precise senses the {@trait undead} possess.
